Package io.github.cjstehno.ersatz

Class ErsatzProxyServer

java.lang.Object
io.github.cjstehno.ersatz.ErsatzProxyServer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, AutoCloseable
@Deprecated public class ErsatzProxyServer extends Object implements Closeable
Deprecated.
The proxy server functionality was removed in a recent release - it has been brought back temporarily, by request, but will be removed again in a near-future release. Use the Request::forward(String) functionality to achieve the same goal.
Standalone simple proxy server useful for testing proxy configurations.

At this time, only HTTP proxies are supported.

  • Constructor Details

    • ErsatzProxyServer

      public ErsatzProxyServer(Consumer<ProxyServerConfig> consumer)
      Deprecated.
      Creates a new proxy server with the specified configuration. The configuration consumer will be provided an instance of ProxyServerConfig for the actual configuration.

      If auto-start is not disabled, the server will be started upon creation.

      Parameters:
      consumer - the configuration consumer

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start()
      Deprecated.
      Starts the proxy server on an ephemeral port on localhost, so that it does not collide with other running servers. Once the server is started (when this method returns) the actual port and url will be available via the server getter methods.

      This method does not need to be called if auto-start is not disabled.

    • verify

      public boolean verify()
      Deprecated.
      Used to verify that the expected requests were proxied.
      Returns:
      a value of true if the expected requests were proxied

    • getUrl

      public String getUrl()
      Deprecated.
      Used to retrieve the full URL of the HTTP proxy server.
      Returns:
      the full URL of the HTTP server

    • getPort

      public int getPort()
      Deprecated.
      Used to retrieve the actual port of the HTTP proxy server.
      Returns:
      the port of the server

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Deprecated.
      Used to stop the proxy server, if it was running.
